item.name: Agents Get Agent Restore Point Mount

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a mount point having the specified ID. The mount point was created for a restore point of a Veeam Agent machine.

item.name: Agents Get Agent Restore Point Filepath Resource

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a file or folder in the guest OS.

item.name: Agents Start Agent Restore Point File-Level Restore

request.description:
Restores a guest OS file or folder. The file or folder can be restored to its original location on the machine or can be downloaded to the local machine.

For file-level restore to the original location, you can use restore points created by a backup job with enabled guest processing settings. In this case, file-level restore will be performed using the guest OS credentials that are specified in the backup job settings.

Alternatively, if guest processing settings are not enabled for the job, you can specify the guest OS credentials in the body of the request. To learn more, see File-Level Restore Options.

item.name: Agents Delete Agent Restore Point Mount

request.description: Deletes a mount point having the specified ID and unmounts disks of the backed-up machine from the Veeam backup server.

item.name: Agents File-Level Agent Restore Point Restore

request.description: Starts the machine guest OS files restore from the specified restore point. Disks of the restored machine are mounted to the Veeam backup server and the machine guest OS files become available under the C:\VeeamFLR\<vm-name> folder.

item.name: Agents Get Agent Restore Point Mounts

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of mount points created for restore points of Veeam Agent machines.
Returns a resource representation of a restore point having the specified ID. A restore point was created for a machine protected with Veeam Agent managed by Veeam Backup & Replication.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points for separate machines in Veeam Agent backups. Backups are created by Veeam Agent managed by Veeam Backup & Replication.

Returns a resource representation of a collection of all Veeam Agent backups on Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager. The resource representation displays backups that were created by Veeam Agent managed by Veeam Backup & Replication. Backups of this type are also displayed in the representation of the /backups resource collection.

Returns a resource representation of a collection of backup files created by Veeam Agent managed by Veeam Backup & Replication. Backup files are created on or imported to Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Returns a resource representation of a collection of sessions performed for Veeam Agent backup jobs configured in Veeam Backup & Replication on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager. Veeam Agent backup job sessions are also displayed in the representation of the /backupSessions resource collection.
Returns a resource representation of a protected computer having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of all protected computers in protection groups configured on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of the Veeam Agent backup job resource having the specified ID. The Veeam Agent backup job is configured in Veeam Backup & Replication.
Starts a Veeam Agent backup job having the specified ID. The Veeam Agent backup job is configured in Veeam Backup & Replication.
Stops a Veeam Agent backup job having the specified ID. The Veeam Agent backup job is configured in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Retries a failed Veeam Agent backup job having the specified ID. The Veeam Agent backup job is configured in Veeam Backup & Replication. The retry action can be performed only for jobs that have been finished with the Failed status.

Disables or enables a Veeam Agent backup job having the specified ID. The Veeam Agent backup job is configured in Veeam Backup & Replication.

A disabled job remains in the list of Veeam Agent backup jobs on the Veeam backup server, but is not run according to specified job scheduling settings. To enable a job, you need to perform the Disable operation once again.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of Veeam Agent backup jobs configured in Veeam Backup & Replication on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a protection group having the specified ID.

item.name: Agents Get Protection Group Discovered Computers

request.description: Returns a resource representation of the collection of discovered computers in a protection group having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of protection groups configured on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Returns a resource representation of a restore points collection for backups created by Veeam Agent managed by Veeam Backup & Replication. Backups are created on or imported to Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a set of links to Veeam Agent Management resources.
Returns a resource representation of a backup having the specified ID. The backup is created on or imported to the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of all ChildBackup resources of a ParentBackup backup type having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points of Standard and ChildBackup backups having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of all backups created on or imported to Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a backup file with the specified ID. The backup file is created on or imported to the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a collection of restore points for a backup file with the specified ID. The backup file was created on or imported to the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Backup Files Get VM Restore Points
Backup Files Get Agent Restore Points

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of backup files created on or imported to Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a credentials record with the specified ID created on the Veeam backup server with the specified ID.

request.description: Creates new credentials on the Veeam backup server having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a password with the specified ID created on the Veeam backup server with the specified ID.
Edits parameters for a password having the specified ID on the Veeam backup server with the specified ID.
Deletes a password having the specified ID from the Veeam backup server with the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of the passwords collection created on the Veeam backup server with the specified ID.
Creates a new password on the Veeam backup server having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of the collection of external backup repositories on a Veeam backup server having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of the Veeam backup server having the specified ID.
Edits settings of a Veeam backup server with the specified ID added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Creates a VeeamZIP file for one or several VMs on the Veeam backup server added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Creates an incremental backup for one or several VMs on the Veeam backup server added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Collects data from the Veeam backup server added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

request.description: Connects a Veeam backup server to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a backup job session having the specified ID.
Stops the job session having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of all task sessions performed with the Backup and Agent type backup job sessions with a specified ID.

item.name: Backup Sessions Get Agent Management Sessions

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of all AgentManagement job sessions performed during the AgentBackup backup session with a specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of all backup job sessions performed on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Backup Task Sessions Get Backup Task Sessions

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a backup tasks collection. Tasks are performed on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Backup Task Sessions Get Backup Task Session

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a task having the specified ID. The parent backup job for the task is created and run on the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Catalog VMs VM Restore Point Get Filepath Resource

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a file or folder in the VM guest OS.

item.name: Catalog VMs VM Restore Point Get File Index

request.description: Returns a resource representation of the hierarchy of the VM guest OS file system within a VM backup.

item.name: Catalog VMs VM Restore Point Restore Filepath Resource

request.description: Starts restore of the specified VM guest OS file or folder from the specified restore point. The file or folder is restored to its original location.

item.name: Catalog VMs Get VM Restore Points

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points for a VM whose guest OS files have been indexed during backup.

item.name: Catalog VMs Get VM Restore Point

request.description: Returns a VM restore point having the specified ID. The restore point is created for a VM having the specified name; guest OS files of the VM have been indexed during backup.

item.name: Catalog VMs File-Level Restore VM Restore Point

request.description: Starts the guest OS file restore process of the VM from the specified restore point. The VM disks are mounted to the Veeam backup server and VM guest OS files become available for restore.

item.name: Catalog VMs Get VM Files Index

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a VM having the specified name whose guest OS files have been indexed during backup.
Returns a resource representation of a VM collection whose guest OS files have been indexed during backup.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Failover Plan VMs

request.description: Returns a list of VMs added to the cloud failover plan that has the specified ID.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Failover Plan VM

request.description: Returns a representation of a VM with the specified ID that is added to the cloud failover plan with the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of the cloud failover plan that has the specified ID.
Deletes a cloud failover plan that has the specified ID from the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Starts a cloud failover plan that has the specified ID.
Triggers the undo failover operation for all VMs added to the cloud failover plan that has the specified ID.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<CloudFailoverPlan Type="CloudFailoverPlan" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/cloudFailoverPlans/e7ca6822-a87f-443d-8aae-8005970543bf?format=Entity" Name="ABC Company Failover Plan" UID="urn:veeam:CloudFailoverPlan:e7ca6822-a87f-443d-8aae-8005970543bf" xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <TenantUid>urn:veeam:CloudTenant:b25f5f1d-a3c3-45ed-af23-9ef31a94dac7</TenantUid>
    <TenantName>ABC Company</TenantName>
    <Description>Cloud failover plan for ABC Company full site failover</Description>
    <CloudFailoverPlanOptions>
        <PostFailoverPlanCommandEnabled>true</PostFailoverPlanCommandEnabled>
        <PostFailoverPlanCommand>C:\scripts\post-failover.bat</PostFailoverPlanCommand>
        <PreFailoverPlanCommandEnabled>true</PreFailoverPlanCommandEnabled>
        <PreFailoverPlanCommand>C:\scripts\pre-failover.bat</PreFailoverPlanCommand>
    </CloudFailoverPlanOptions>
    <CloudFailoverPlanInfo>
        <Includes>
            <CloudFailoverPlanVm Type="CloudFailoveredVm" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/cloudFailoverPlans/e7ca6822-a87f-443d-8aae-8005970543bf/includes/231a6e3e-09e6-4641-9322-40898fcb966a">
                <FailoverPlanVMId>231a6e3e-09e6-4641-9322-40898fcb966a</FailoverPlanVMId>
                <Name>srv38</Name>
                <Order>0</Order>
            </CloudFailoverPlanVm>
            <CloudFailoverPlanVm Type="CloudFailoveredVm" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/cloudFailoverPlans/e7ca6822-a87f-443d-8aae-8005970543bf/includes/096a7d0a-c92a-4da4-9302-4416b2fe929f">
                <FailoverPlanVMId>096a7d0a-c92a-4da4-9302-4416b2fe929f</FailoverPlanVMId>
                <Name>srv40</Name>
                <Order>1</Order>
            </CloudFailoverPlanVm>
        </Includes>
    </CloudFailoverPlanInfo>
</CloudFailoverPlan>

request.description: Edits a cloud failover plan that has the specified ID.

<CloudGateway Type="CloudGateway" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/gateways/b5025a7b-5e13-41e2-a17e-9d9af985ecfd?format=Entity" Name="172.16.13.97" UID="urn:veeam:CloudGateway:b5025a7b-5e13-41e2-a17e-9d9af985ecfd" xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

</CloudGateway>

request.description: Edits settings of a cloud gateway with the specified ID.
Deletes a cloud gateway having the specified ID from the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of cloud gateways configured on all Veeam Backup Servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Configures a new cloud gateway on the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

To configure a cloud gateway, Veeam Backup & Replication assigns the cloud gateway role to a Microsoft Windows server. Note that the Microsoft Windows server must be added to the backup infrastructure beforehand.
Returns a resource representation of a cloud gateway pool with the specified ID.
Deletes a cloud gateway pool with the specified ID from the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<CloudGatewayPool Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/gatewayPools/dcdca4d9-f850-4094-813e-f1aa9ba8bcfb?format=Entity" Type="CloudGatewayPool" Name="Cloud gateway pool 1" UID="urn:veeam:CloudGatewayPool:dcdca4d9-f850-4094-813e-f1aa9ba8bcfb" xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

request.description: Edits settings of a cloud gateway pool with the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of cloud gateway pools configured on all Veeam Backup Servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Configures a new cloud gateway pool on the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

To configure a cloud gateway pool, you must have at least one cloud gateway configured on the Veeam backup server.
Returns a resource representation of a hardware plan that has the specified ID.

item.name: Cloud Get Tenants assigned to Hardware Plan

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of tenant accounts that are subscribed to the hardware plan with the specified ID.
Deletes a hardware plan that has the specified ID from the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<CloudHardwarePlan Type="CloudHardwarePlan" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/hardwarePlans/e8c0a941-cda3-488d-8a41-b53d747f3a92?format=Entity" Name="VMware" UID="urn:veeam:CloudHardwarePlan:e8c0a941-cda3-488d-8a41-b53d747f3a92" xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <Description>Hardware Plan for VMware</Description>
    <ProcessorUsageLimitMhz>10000</ProcessorUsageLimitMhz>
    <MemoryUsageLimitMb>20000</MemoryUsageLimitMb>
    <HardwarePlanDetails>
        <ViCloudHardwarePlan>
            <HypervisorHostRef>urn:VMware:Host:b7f17482-2f34-446c-976c-924539a98b0b.host-438</HypervisorHostRef>
            <ParentType>HostSystem</ParentType>
            <ParentName>esx01.tech.local</ParentName>
            <Datastores>
                <Datastore Id="5df6b488-3a56-4dde-88d2-5e1c93280395">
                    <FriendlyName>Cloud Replicas</FriendlyName>
                    <DatastoreType>Datastore</DatastoreType>
                    <Reference>urn:VMware:Datastore:e8c0a941-cda3-488d-8a41-b53d747f3a92.datastore-441</Reference>
                    <RootPath/>
                    <QuotaGb>500</QuotaGb>
                </Datastore>
            </Datastores>
        </ViCloudHardwarePlan>
    </HardwarePlanDetails>
</CloudHardwarePlan>

request.description: Edits settings of a hardware plan with the specified ID.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Connect Hardware Plans

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of hardware plans configured on all Veeam Backup Servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Cloud Create Cloud Connect Hardware Plan

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<CloudHardwarePlanCreateSpec xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <BackupServerUid>urn:veeam:BackupServer:8fff3b8e-c3f1-4ef5-aecc-561f07bf9982</BackupServerUid>
    <Name>VMware Gold</Name>
    <Description>Hardware Plan for VMware</Description>
    <ProcessorUsageLimitMhz>10000</ProcessorUsageLimitMhz>
    <MemoryUsageLimitMb>20000</MemoryUsageLimitMb>
    <HardwarePlanDetails>
        <ViCloudHardwarePlan>
            <HypervisorHostRef>urn:VMware:Host:b7f17482-2f34-446c-976c-924539a98b0b.host-438</HypervisorHostRef>
            <ParentType>HostSystem</ParentType>
            <ParentName>esx01.tech.local</ParentName>
            <Datastores>
                <Datastore>
                    <FriendlyName>Cloud Replicas</FriendlyName>
                    <DatastoreType>Datastore</DatastoreType>
                    <Reference>urn:VMware:Datastore:ed6ad5f1-671b-4875-9d81-72a431953aca.datastore-441</Reference>
                    <QuotaGb>500</QuotaGb>
                </Datastore>
            </Datastores>
            <Network>
                <CountWithInternet>1</CountWithInternet>
                <CountWithoutInternet>0</CountWithoutInternet>
            </Network>
        </ViCloudHardwarePlan>
    </HardwarePlanDetails>
</CloudHardwarePlanCreateSpec>

request.description: Configures a new hardware plan on the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of public IP addresses. Public IP addresses are allocated in the service provider's network infrastructure and added to pools of public IP addresses on Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Deletes a tenant account with the specified ID from the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<CloudTenant Type="CloudTenant" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/tenants/b25f5f1d-a3c3-45ed-af23-9ef31a94dac7?format=Entity" Name="ABC Company" UID="urn:veeam:CloudTenant:b25f5f1d-a3c3-45ed-af23-9ef31a94dac7" xmlns="http://www.veeam.com/ent/v1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <Description>Tenant account for ABC Company</Description>
    <Enabled>true</Enabled>
    <LeaseOptions Enabled="false"/>
    <Resources>
        <CloudTenantResource Type="CloudTenantResource" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/tenants/b25f5f1d-a3c3-45ed-af23-9ef31a94dac7/resources/2fcc7f11-2a33-448d-a242-ba8f0618c97b" Id="2fcc7f11-2a33-448d-a242-ba8f0618c97b">
            <RepositoryQuota>
                <DisplayName>ABC Cloud Vol1</DisplayName>
                <RepositoryUid>urn:veeam:Repository:a0f35f34-8d58-4470-b52d-071e1417732a</RepositoryUid>
                <WanAcceleratorUid>urn:veeam:WanAccelerator:34ebeeb4-75d0-4e71-b315-fbc16eb2975f</WanAcceleratorUid>
                <Quota>307200</Quota>
            </RepositoryQuota>
        </CloudTenantResource>
        <CloudTenantResource Type="CloudTenantResource" Href="http://localhost:9399/api/cloud/tenants/b25f5f1d-a3c3-45ed-af23-9ef31a94dac7/resources/8c6aa6b6-4668-4f81-9729-60c56b9b300b" Id="8c6aa6b6-4668-4f81-9729-60c56b9b300b">
            <RepositoryQuota>
                <DisplayName>Cloud Repository 2</DisplayName>
                <RepositoryUid>urn:veeam:Repository:0a9c15f5-bc17-4848-a14b-b2ec3f9919ea</RepositoryUid>
                <Quota>102400</Quota>
            </RepositoryQuota>
        </CloudTenantResource>

request.description: Edits settings of a tenant account with the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of tenant accounts created on all Veeam Backup Servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Creates a new tenant account on the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Connect VM Replica Points

request.description:
Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points for separate VMs in a cloud replica with the specified ID.

To get a list of restore points for separate tenant VMs in a cloud replica with the specified ID, you need to send the GET HTTP request to the URL of the /cloud/replicas/{ID}/vmReplicaPoints resource.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Connect VM Replica Point

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a VM replica restore point that has the specified ID. VM is replicated with the tenant replication job.

Returns a virtual switch with the specified ID on which VLAN ranges for Veeam Cloud Connect Replication are reserved. VLANs are used for providing networking capabilities to tenant VM replicas. The virtual switch is configured on the virtualization host that is used as a replication target and connected to the Veeam backup server managed by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Deletes VLAN ranges that are reserved for Veeam Cloud Connect Replication from the virtual switch with the specified ID.
Edits VLAN ranges that are reserved for Veeam Cloud Connect Replication on the virtual switch with the specified ID.

Returns a resource representation of a collection of all virtual switches on which VLAN ranges for Veeam Cloud Connect Replication are reserved. VLANs are used for providing networking capabilities to tenant VM replicas. Virtual switches are configured on virtualization hosts that are used as a replication target and connected to Veeam backup servers managed by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Connect Failover Sessions

request.description: Returns a collection of cloud failover sessions performed on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager. A new cloud failover session is started every time you start or undo a cloud failover plan. When the start or undo a cloud failover plan operation completes, a cloud failover session ends

item.name: Cloud Get Cloud Connect Failover Session

request.description: Returns a cloud failover session that has the specified ID.
Returns a set of links to Veeam Cloud Connect resources.

Returns a resource representation of an external backup repository having the specified ID. The external backup repository is added to the Veeam backup server connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: External Repositories Get External Repository Backups

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of all backups on Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager filtered by an external repository with a specified ID as a target repository. The backups are also represented in the /backups resource collection.
Returns a resource representation of the collection of external backup repositories on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of the failover plan having the specified ID.

request.description: Creates a copy of the job having the specified ID. The cloned job is registered on the same Veeam backup server where the initial job is created.

Disables or enables a job having the specified ID. A disabled job remains in the list of created jobs on the Veeam backup server but is not run according to specified job scheduling settings. To enable a job, you need to perform the Disable operation once again.

Returns a resource representation of an overview report about backup infrastructure components and performed backup and replication jobs.
Returns a resource representation of an overview report about backed up and replicated VMs, available restore points and so on.
Returns an overview report about performed jobs, their status, duration and other job-related information.
Returns an overview report about the number of VMs processed per day.
Returns an overview report about backup repositories, their capacity, free space and size of backup files on these backup repositories.

Returns a resource representation of the collection of backup repositories created on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Returns a resource representation of a restore points collection for backups and replicas created on or imported to Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a restore session having the specified ID.
Returns a collection of restore sessions performed on all Veeam backup servers connected to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a specific security role assigned to the specified account that is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Removes the Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager security role from the account having the specified ID.
Returns a security role or a collection of security roles assigned to the specified account that is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Assigns a Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager security role to the specified user account.
Removes a restore scope having the specified ID from the account having the specified ID. The account is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager and is assigned a specific security role.
Returns a restore scope having the specified ID. The scope is defined for the account that is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager and is assigned a specific security role.
Returns a restore scope defined for the specified account. The account is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager and is assigned a specific security role.
Assigns a restore scope to the account having the specified ID. The account is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager and has a specific security role.
Returns an account having the specified ID. The account is added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager and is assigned a specific security role.

Enables or disables the Restore scope: All virtual machines option specified for the account.

The account added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager can be assigned a permission to restore all VMs in the virtual infrastructure or only those VMs that belong to a specific level: for example, VMs that reside in a specific resource pool. By sending the POST HTTP request to the /security/accounts/{ID} URL, the client can toggle this setting to enabled or disabled.
Removes an account having the specified ID and a specific security role from Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Returns a security role having the specified ID. The security role belongs to a list of roles used in Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager REST API exposes the following security roles:

- Portal User
- Portal Administrator
- VM Restore Operator
- File Restore Operator
- Exchange Restore Operator
- SQL Restore Operator

Returns a resource representation of the security resource. The security resource provides access to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager security settings and allows the client to manage roles used in Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a collection of accounts having specific security roles in Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

item.name: Security Add Account to Security Role

request.description: Adds a user or a group account having a specific security role to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Rebuilds a restore scope for user accounts added to Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.

Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager periodically rescans the virtual infrastructure to get the latest data about the virtual infrastructure hierarchy and rebuild the restore scope for user accounts. The rescan procedure is performed automatically once a day. You can start the rebuild scope operation manually when you need to perform rescan. For example, you can perform this operation in case new VMs have been created and you want to immediately include them to the restore scope for some users.
Returns a collection of security roles used in Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
Returns a resource representation of a task having the specified ID. The task is created by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager in response to client requests.
Removes a task having the specified ID.
Returns a resource representation of a collection of tasks created by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager within the currently existing logon session.

The default organization configuration always appears in the list of configurations under the name Other organizations. When you disable the default configuration, vCloud Director organizations for which individual configurations were not created can no longer perform self-service backup.

Returns a resource representation of a collection of vCloud Director organization configurations.

item.name: VM Replica Points Get Filepath Resource

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a file or folder in the VM replica guest OS.

item.name: VM Replica Points Restore Filepath Resource

request.description: Deletes a mount point having the specified ID and unmounts the VM replica disks from the Veeam backup server.

item.name: VM Replica Points File-Level Restore VM Replica Point

request.description:
Starts the VM guest OS files restore from the specified VM replica restore point. Disks of the restored VM are mounted to the Veeam backup server and the VM guest OS files become available in the C:\VeeamFLR\<vm-name> folder.

Veeam Backup & Replication detects guest OS on the mounted backup automatically. With Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager RESTful API you can define the type of the guest OS manually. If you do not define the type of the guest OS manually, Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager will use the default value. The default value for the guest OS is Windows.
Returns a resource representation of a VM replica mount points collection.

item.name: VM Replica Points Get VM Replica Point

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a VM replica restore point having the specified ID.

item.name: VM Replica Points Failover VM Replica Point

request.description: Starts the VM replica failover process.

item.name: VM Replica Points Get VM Replica Points

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points for separate replicated VMs.
Returns a resource representation of a mount point having the specified ID.

item.name: VM Restore Points Get Filepath Resource

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a file or folder in the VM guest OS.

item.name: VM Restore Points Restore Filepath Resource

request.description:
Restores a VM guest OS file or folder. The file or folder can be restored to its original location on the VM or can be downloaded to the local machine.

For file-level restore to the original location, you can use restore points created by a backup job with enabled guest processing settings. In this case, file-level restore will be performed using the guest OS credentials that are specified in the backup job settings.

Alternatively, if guest processing settings are not enabled for the job, you can specify the guest OS credentials in the body of the request. To learn more, see File-Level Restore Options.
Deletes a mount point having the specified ID and unmounts the VM disks from the Veeam backup server.
Returns a resource representation of a mount points collection.

item.name: VM Restore Points Get VM Restore Point

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a VM restore point having the specified ID.

item.name: VM Restore Points Full VM Restore

request.description: Starts the full VM restore process from the restore point having the specified ID.

Starts the VM guest OS files restore from the specified restore point. Disks of the restored VM are mounted to the Veeam backup server and the VM guest OS files become available under the C:\VeeamFLR\<vm-name> folder.

Veeam Backup & Replication detects guest OS on the mounted backup automatically. With Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager RESTful API you can define the type of the guest OS manually. If you do not define the type of the guest OS manually, Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager will use the default value. The default value for the guest OS is Windows.

item.name: VM Restore Points Get VM Restore Points

request.description: Returns a resource representation of a collection of restore points for separate VMs in backup files.
